holidays.name: World No Tobacco Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the dangers of tobacco use and advocate for effective policies to reduce tobacco consumption worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the World Health Organization in 1987 to highlight the health risks associated with tobacco and encourage people to quit.
holidays.funFact: World No Tobacco Day sparks global events such as the 'No Smoking' flash mobs and creative smoke-free art installations every year!

holidays.name: Put a Pillow on Your Fridge Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday that encourages people to put a pillow on their fridge as a symbol of protection for their food and a reminder to chill out and relax.
holidays.origin: A humorous, unofficial holiday with unclear origins, celebrated mostly in North America as a fun way to 'cool off'.
holidays.funFact: Some people claim putting a pillow on the fridge 'absorbs the chill' ‚Äì even though fridges and pillows don‚Äôt exactly mix scientifically!

holidays.name: Learn about Composting Day
holidays.description: This day promotes understanding of composting and its benefits, encouraging people to start composting to reduce waste and enrich soil naturally.
holidays.origin: Started by environmental groups to boost eco-friendly waste management practices in communities around the world.
holidays.funFact: Composting can reduce household waste by up to 30%, turning kitchen scraps into black gold for your garden!
